div1.head: γάγγαμον
div1.sense: a small round net: metaph. a net, δουλείας γ. Aesch.

div1.head: Γαδείραθεν
div1.sense: adv., from Cadiz, Anth.

div1.head: Γαδειραῖος
div1.sense: Γαδειραῖος πορθμός the Straits of Gibraltar, Plut.

div1.head: Γάδειρα
div1.sense: Lat. Gades, Cadiz, Hdt.

div1.head: γάζα
div1.sense: Lat. gaza, treasure, Theophr.

div1.head: γαζοφυλάκιον
div1.sense: a treasury, NTest.

div1.head: γαζοφύλαξ
div1.sense: a treasurer.

div1.head: γαῖα
div1.sense: a land, country, Hom., Trag.; φίλην ἐς πατρίδα γαῖαν to oneʼs dear father land, Hom.
earth, soil, Il.
Γαῖα, as prop. n., Gaia, Tellus, Earth, spouse of Uranus, mother of the Titans, Hes.

div1.head: Γαιήϊος
div1.sense: sprung from Gaia or Earth, Od.

div1.head: γαιήοχος
div1.sense: poet. for γηοῦχος, earth-upholding, of Poseidon, Hom., Trag.
protecting the country, Soph.

div1.head: γάϊος
div1.sense: on land, Aesch.

div1.head: γαίω
div1.etym: The Root was !γαυ, or !γαϝ, cf. γαῦρος, Lat. gaudium.
div1.sense: to exult, only in part. κύδεϊ γαίων Il.

div1.head: γαλαθηνός
div1.sense: sucking, young, tender, Od., Theocr.; γαλαθηνά (sc. πρόβατα), Hdt.

div1.head: γαλάκτινος
div1.sense: milky, milk-white, Anth.

div1.head: γαλακτοπαγής
div1.sense: like curdled milk, Anth.

div1.head: γαλακτοπότης
div1.sense: a milk-drinker, Hdt.

div1.head: γαλακτοφάγος
div1.sense: milk-fed, Strab.

div1.head: γάλα
div1.etym: The Root seems to be γλακ, or γλαγ, cf. gen. γάλακτος, γλάγος, and (with γ dropt) Lat. lac, lactis
div1.sense: milk, Hom., etc.; ὀρνίθων γάλα, proverb. of rare and dainty things, Ar.

div1.head: γαλέη
div1.sense: a weasel, marten-cat or polecat, Lat. mustela, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: γαλερός
div1.sense: cheerful: adv. -ρῶς, Anth.

div1.head: γαλεώτης
div1.sense: a spotted lizard, Lat. stellio, Ar.

div1.head: γαλήνη
div1.etym: Deriv. uncertain: perh. akin to γελάω.
div1.sense: stillness of the sea, calm, Od.; λευκὴ γ. Od.; ἐλόωσι γαλήνην will sail the calm sea, i. e. over it, Od.:—metaph., φρόνημα νηνέμου γαλάνας spirit of serenest calm, Aesch.; ἐν γαλήνηι in calm, Soph.

div1.head: γαληνιάω
div1.sense: to be calm, Epic part. γαληνιόωσα Anth.

div1.head: γαληνός
div1.sense: calm; γαλήνʼ ὁρῶ I see a calm, Eur.; of persons, gentle, Eur.

div1.head: γάλοως
div1.sense: a husbandʼs sister or brotherʼs wife, a sister-in-law, Lat. glos, Il., etc.

div1.head: γαμβρός
div1.sense: any one connected by marriage, Lat. affinis, Aesch.:
a son-in-law, Lat. gener, Hom., Hdt., Eur.
a brother-in-law, a sisterʼs husband, Il., Hdt.; or, a wifeʼs brother Soph.
= πενθερός, a father-in-law, Eur.
Doric and Aeolic a bridegroom, wooer, suitor, Pind., Theocr.

div1.head: γαμετή
div1.sense: fem. of γαμέτης a married woman, wife, γυνὴ γαμ. a wedded wife, Hes.

div1.head: γαμέτης
div1.sense: a husband, spouse, Aesch., Eur.; Doric gen. γαμέτα, Eur.

div1.head: γαμέτις
div1.sense: a wife, Anth.

div1.head: γαμέω
div1.sense: to marry, i. e. to take to wife, Lat. ducere, of the man, Hom., etc.; ἔγημε θυγατρῶν married one of his daughters, Il.:—c. acc. cogn., γάμον γαμεῖν, Aesch., Eur.:— ἐκ κακοῦ, ἐξ ἀγαθοῦ γῆμαι to marry a wife of mean or noble stock, Theogn.
Mid. to give oneself or oneʼs child in marriage:

of the woman, to give herself in marriage, i. e. to get married, to wed, Lat. nubere, c. dat., Od., Hdt.; γήμασθαι εἰς . . to marry into a family, Eur.:—ironically of a henpecked husband, κεῖνος οὐκ ἔγημεν ἀλλʼ ἐγήματο Anacr.; (cf. Martial, uxori nubere nolo meae); so Medea speaks contemptuously of Jason, as if she were the husband, γαμοῦσα σέ Eur.
of the parents, to get their children married, or betroth them, to get a wife for the son, Πηλεύς μοι γυναῖκα γαμέσσεται Il.

div1.head: γαμήλιος
div1.sense: belonging to a wedding, bridal, Aesch., Eur.
γαμηλία (sc. θυσία), a wedding feast, Dem.

div1.head: Γαμηλιών
div1.sense: the seventh month of the Attic year, from γαμέω, because it was the fashionable time for weddings;— the last half of January and first of February, Arist.

div1.head: γαμίζω
div1.sense: to give in marriage, NTest.

div1.head: γαμικός
div1.sense: of or for marriage, Plat.; τὰ γαμ. a bridal, wedding, Thuc.

div1.head: γάμμα
div1.sense: indecl, third letter in Gr. alphabet; as Numeral γʼ three, third: but ,γ 3.

γ is the medial palatal mute, between tenuis κ and asp. χ. Before the palatals γ, κ, χ and before ξ, pronounced like n in ng, as in ἄγγος, ἄγκος, ἄγχι, ἄγξω: before the same letters ἐν- in compos. becomes ἐγ-.
changes of γ, etc.:
γ is sometimes prefixed, αἶα γαῖα, lac γλάγος, γάλακτος, νοέω γνῶναι, νέφος γνόφος.
sometimes interchanged with β, v. βῆτα I. 1; sometimes with κ, γνάπτω κνάπτω.

div1.head: γαμοκλόπος
div1.sense: adulterous, Anth.

div1.head: γάμος
div1.sense: a wedding, wedding-feast, Hom., etc.
marriage, wedlock, Hom., etc.; τὸν Οἰνέως γ. marriage with him, Soph.; mostly in pl., like Lat. nuptiae, nuptials, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: γαμοστόλος
div1.sense: preparing a wedding, Lat. pronuba, epith. of Hera and Aphrodite, Anth.

div1.head: γαμφηλαί
div1.sense: the jaws of animals; of the lion, Il.; of the horse, Il.; of Typhon, Aesch.: the bill or beak of birds, Eur.

div1.head: γαμψός
div1.sense: curved: of birds of prey.

div1.head: γαμψῶνυξ
div1.sense: with crooked talons, of birds of prey, Hom., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: γανάω
div1.sense: to shine, glitter, gleam, of metals, Hom.: then, like Lat. nitere, to look bright, of garden-beds, Od.

div1.head: γάνος
div1.sense: brightness, sheen: gladness, joy, pride, Aesch.; of water διόσδοτον γάνος, of refreshing rain, Aesch.; γ. ἀμπέλον of wine, Aesch.

div1.head: γανόω
div1.sense: to make bright:— Pass. to be made glad, exult, Ar.; part. perf. pass. γεγανωμένος, like Lat. nitidus, glad-looking, joyous, Plat.

div1.head: γάνυμαι
div1.sense: to brighten up, γάνυται φρένα he is glad at heart, Il.; c. dat., to be glad at a thing, Hom.; c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: γάποτος
div1.sense: to be drunk up by Earth, of libations, Aesch.

div1.head: γαργαλίζω
div1.sense: to tickle, Lat. titillare, Plat.:—Pass., generally, to feel tickling or irritation, Plat.

div1.head: γάργαρα
div1.sense: heaps, lots, plenty; cf. ψαμμακοσιογάργαρα.

div1.head: γάρ
div1.sense: for, Lat. enim, and like it, regularly placed after the first word of a sentence: to introduce the reason:

ARGUMENTATIVE, to introduce the reason for a statement, which usually precedes:—when it precedes the statement, it may be rendered since, as, Ἀτρείδη, πολλοὶ γὰρ τεθνᾶσιν Ἀχαιοί, χρὴ πόλεμον παῦσαι Il.

the statement of which γάρ gives the reason may be omitted, οὐ γάρ τί μοι Ζεὺς ἦν ὁ κηρύξας τάδε yes], for it was not Zeus, etc., Soph.; ἔστι γὰρ οὕτω yes], for so it is, i. e. yes certainly, Plat.; οἵδʼ οὐκέτʼ εἰσί· τοῦτο γάρ σε δήξεται I say this], for it will sting thee, Eur.: —in Conditional Propositions, where the Condition is omitted, it may be transl. for otherwise, else, οὐ γὰρ ἄν με ἔπεμπον πάλιν, (sc. εἰ μὴ ἐπίστευον), Xen.

EPEXEGETIC, where γάρ is used to begin a promised narration, λεκτέα ἃ γιγνώσκω· ἔχει γὰρ ἡ χώρα πεδία κάλλιστα I must relate what I know; now, the country has most beautiful plains, Xen.; so, after the introductory forms, σκέψασθε δέ, δῆλον δέ, τεκμήριον δέ, μαρτύριον δέ, μέγιστον δέ, Plat., etc.; τούτου δὲ τεκμήριον· τόδε γάρ . . , Hdt.:—in ἀλλὰ γάρ, a clause must be supplied between ἀλλά and γάρ, as, ἀλλὰ γὰρ ἤκουσα but [say no more], for I heard, Aesch.
STRENGTHENING,
a question, like Lat. nam, Engl. why, what, τίς γάρ σε ἧκεν; why who hath sent thee? Il.; τί γάρ; quid enim? i. e. it must be so, Soph.
a wish, with the opt., κακῶς γὰρ ἐξόλοιο O that you might perish! Eur.; in Hom. mostly αἲ γάρ, Attic εἰ or εἴθε γάρ, Lat. utinam, O that! so also πῶς γάρ would that.

div1.head: γαστήρ
div1.sense: the paunch, belly, Lat. venter, Hom., etc.: hence, γ. ἀσπίδος the hollow of a shield, Tyrtae.:—often to express greed or gluttony, γαστέρες οἶον mere bellies, Hes.; γαστρὸς ἐγκρατής master of his belly, γαστρὸς ἥττων a slave to it, Xen.
the paunch stuffed with mince-meat, a black-pudding, sausage, Od., Ar.
the womb, Lat. uterus, γαστέρι φέρειν to be with child, Il.; so, ἐκ γαστρός from the womb, from infancy, Theogn.; ἐν γαστρὶ ἔχειν Hdt.

div1.head: γάστρα
div1.sense: the lower part of a vessel bulging out like a paunch, Hom.

div1.head: γαστρίζω
div1.sense: to punch a man in the belly, Ar.

div1.head: γαστριμαργία
div1.sense: gluttony, Plat.

div1.head: γάστρις
div1.sense: a glutton, Ar.

div1.head: γαστροβαρής
div1.sense: heavy with child, Anth.

div1.head: γαστροειδής
div1.sense: paunchlike, round, ναῦς, Plut.

div1.head: γαστροφορέω
div1.sense: to bear in the belly, of a bottle, Anth.

div1.head: γαστρώδης
div1.sense: pot-bellied, Ar.

div1.head: γάστρων
div1.sense: "fat-guts, " Ar.

div1.head: γατόμος
div1.sense: cleaving the ground, Anth.

div1.head: γαυλικός
div1.sense: of or for a merchant vessel, Xen.

div1.head: γαυλός
div1.sense: a milk-pail, Od.: a water-bucket, Hdt.; any round vessel, a bee-hive, Anth.; a drinking-bowl, Theocr.

div1.head: γαῦλος
div1.sense: a round-built Phoenician merchant vessel, opp. to the μακρὰ ναῦς used for war, Hdt.

div1.head: γαυρίαμα
div1.sense: arrogance, exultation, Plut.

div1.head: γαυριάω
div1.etym: mostly in pres. act. and mid.
div1.sense: to bear oneself proudly, prance, of horses, Plut.; and in Mid., Xen.:—metaph. to pride oneself on a thing, c. dat., Dem.; ἐπί σφισι Theocr.

div1.head: γαυρόω
div1.sense: In mid., like γαυριάω, to exult, Batr.: to pride oneself on a thing, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: γαῦρος
div1.sense: exulting in a thing, c. dat., Eur.: absol. haughty, disdainful, Ar.; of a calf, skittish, Theocr.:— τὸ γ. γαυρότης, Eur.

div1.head: γαυρότης
div1.sense: exultation, ferocity, Plut.

div1.head: γαύρωμα
div1.sense: a subject for boasting, Eur.

div1.head: γαύσαπος
div1.sense: rough cloth, like freeze, Strab.

div1.head: γδουπέω
div1.sense: poet. form for δουπέω, ἐπὶ δʼ ἐγδούπησαν Il.

div1.head: γέγωνα
div1.sense: Epic perf. with pres. signf., pluperf. used as impf., to call out so as to be heard, ὅσσον τε γέγωνε βοήσας as far as a man can make himself heard by shouting, Od.:—c. dat. pers. to cry out to, id=Od.

div1.head: γεγωνέω
div1.sense: used in same sense as γέγωνα,Hom.
c. acc. rei, to tell out, proclaim, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: γεγωνίσκω
div1.sense: to cry aloud, Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to tell out, proclaim, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: γεγωνός
div1.sense: loud-sounding, Aesch.: loud of voice, Anth.:—comp. γεγωνότερος, Aesch.

div1.head: γέεννα
div1.sense: = Hebr. ge-hinnom, i. e. the valley of Hinnom, which represented the place of future punishment, NTest.

div1.head: γειαρότης
div1.sense: a plougher of earth, Anth.

div1.head: γείνομαι
div1.sense: as Pass., only in pres. and imperf., to be born, like γίγνομαι, γεινομένωι at oneʼs birth, Hom.; 1st pl. Epic imperf. γεινόμεθα Il.
Causal in aor1 mid., of the father, to beget, Il., Trag.; of the mother, to bring forth, Hom.; ἡ γειναμένη the mother, Hdt., Eur.; and οἱ γεινάμενοι the parents, Hdt., Xen.
of Zeus, to bring men into being, Od.

div1.head: γειοφόρος
div1.sense: earth-bearing, Anth.

div1.head: γεῖσον
div1.sense: the projecting part of the roof, the eaves, cornice, coping, Eur.

div1.head: γειτνίασις
div1.sense: neighbourhood: the neighbours, Plut.

div1.head: γειτνιάω
div1.sense: mostly in pres., to be a neighbour, to border on, c. dat., Ar., Dem.

div1.head: γειτόνημα
div1.sense: neighbourhood: a neighbouring place, Plat.

div1.head: γειτονία
div1.sense: neighbourhood, Plat.

div1.head: γειτόσυνος
div1.sense: neighbouring, Anth.

div1.head: γείτων
div1.sense: one of the same land, a neighbour, Lat. vici-nus (from vicus), Od.; γείτων τινός or τινί oneʼs neighbour, Eur., Xen.:— ἐκ τῶν γειτόνων or ἐκ γειτόνων from or in the neighbourhood, Ar., Plat.; as adj. neighbouring, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: γελασείω
div1.sense: to be like to laugh, ready to laugh, Plat.

div1.head: γέλασμα
div1.sense: a laugh, κυμάτων ἀνήριθμον γέλασμα the many-twinkling smile of Ocean, " Aesch.

div1.head: γελαστής
div1.sense: a laugher, sneerer, Soph.

div1.head: γελαστικός
div1.sense: inclined to laugh, Luc.

div1.head: γελαστός
div1.sense: laughable, Od.

div1.head: γελάω
div1.sense: absol. to laugh, Hom., etc.; ἐγέλασσεν χείλεσιν, of feigned laughter, Il.:—Pass., ἕνεκα τοῦ γελασθῆναι for the sake of a laugh being raised, Dem.
to laugh at a person, Lat. irrideo, ἐπί τινι Il., Aesch.; also at a thing, Xen.; so c. dat., Soph., etc.; rarely, like καταγελάω, c. gen. pers., Soph.
c. acc. to deride, τινά or τι Theocr., Ar.:—Pass. to be derided, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: γέλγις
div1.sense: a clove of garlic, Anth.

div1.head: γελοιομελέω
div1.sense: to write comic songs, Anth.

div1.head: γέλοιος
div1.sense: causing laughter, laughable, Il., Hdt., etc.; γελοῖα jests, Theogn.
of persons, causing laughter, ridiculous, Plat., etc.

div1.head: γελοωμιλία
div1.sense: fellowship in laughing, Anth.

div1.head: γέλως
div1.sense: laughter, γέλωι ἔκθανον they were like to die with laughing, Od.; γέλωτα ποιεῖν, κινεῖν, etc., Xen.;— κατέχειν γέλωτα to restrain oneʼs laughter, Xen.; γέλωτα ὀφλεῖν to incur laughter, Eur.; ἐπὶ γέλωτι to provoke laughter, Hdt., Ar.; γέλωτος ἄξια ridiculous, Eur.
occasion of laughter, matter for laughter, γ. γίγνομαί τινι Soph.

div1.head: γελωτοποιέω
div1.sense: to create, make laughter, esp. by buffoonery, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: γελωτοποιΐα
div1.sense: buffoonery, Xen.

div1.head: γελωτοποιός
div1.sense: exciting laughter: as Subst. a jester, buffoon, Xen.

div1.head: γεμίζω
div1.sense: to fill full of, to load or freight with, a cargo of a ship, c. gen., Thuc., etc.; σποδοῦ γ. λέβητας charging the urns with ashes, Aesch.:—Pass. to be laden or freighted, Dem.
later in Pass., c. acc., οἶνον γεμισθείς Anth.

div1.head: γέμος
div1.sense: a load, freight, Aesch.

div1.head: γέμω
div1.sense: to be full, of a ship, Hdt., Xen.
c. gen. rei, to be full of a thing, Thuc., etc.; metaph., Trag.

div1.head: γενεαλογέω
div1.sense: to trace by way of pedigree, γεν. γένεσιν Hdt.; γεν. τινα to draw out his pedigree, Hdt.: —Pass., ταῦτα μέν νυν γεγενηλόγηται Hdt.; γενεαλογούμενος ἔκ τινος NTest.

div1.head: γενεαλογία
div1.sense: the making a pedigree, Plat.

div1.head: γενεαλόγος
div1.sense: a genealogist.

div1.head: γενεά
div1.sense: of the persons in a family.

race, stock, family, Hom., etc.; Πριάμου γ. Il.; ἐκ γενεῆς according to his family, Il.; γενεῆι by birth-right, Od.; γενεὴν Αἰτωλός by descent, Il.:—of horses, a breed, Il.:—generally, γενεήν in kind, Hdt.:—also a tribe, nation, Περσῶν γ. Aesch.
a race, generation, οἵηπερ φύλλων γενεὴ τοιήδε καὶ ἀνδρῶν Il.; δύο γενεαὶ ἀνθρώπων Il.
offspring, Orac. ap. Hdt.; and of a single person, Soph.
of time or place in reference to birth:
a birth-place, γενεὴ ἐπὶ λίμνηι Γυγαίηι Il.; of an eagleʼs eyrie, Od.
age, time of life, esp. in phrases γενεῆι νεώτατος, πρεσβύτατος youngest, eldest, in age, or by birth, Hom.
time of birth, ἐκ γενεῆς Hdt.; ἀπὸ γ. Xen.

div1.head: γενεῆθεν
div1.sense: from birth, by descent, Anth.

div1.head: γενέθλη
div1.sense: of persons, race, tock, family, Hom.; of horses, a breed, stock, Il.
race, offspring, Soph.
of place or time, birth-place: metaph., ἀργύρου γ. a silver- mine, Il.

div1.head: γενεθλιακός
div1.sense: of or for a birthday, Anth.

div1.head: γενέθλιος
div1.sense: of or belonging to oneʼs birth, Lat. natalis, γ. δόσις a birthday gift, Aesch.; ἡ γενέθλιος (with or without ἡμέρα) oneʼs birth-day, Inscr.; so τὰ γενέθλια a birthday feast, birthday offerings, Eur.
of oneʼs race or family, esp. of tutelary gods (dii gentiles), Ζεὺς γ. Pind.; γ. θεοί Aesch.:— γενέθλιον αἷμα kindred blood, Eur.; γ. ἀραί a parentʼs curse, Aesch.
giving birth, γεν. πόρος thy natal stream, Aesch.; βλάσται γεν. Soph.

div1.head: γένεθλον
div1.sense: = γενέθλη race, descent, Aesch.
= γέννημα, offspring, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: γενειάσκω
div1.sense: to begin to get a beard, Plat.

div1.head: γενειάς
div1.sense: a beard, Od., Trag.
in pl. the sides of the face, cheeks, Eur.

div1.head: γενειάτης
div1.sense: bearded, Theocr.

div1.head: γενειάω
div1.sense: to grow a beard, get a beard, Od., Xen., etc.

div1.head: γένειον
div1.sense: the part covered by the beard, the chin, Hom., Trag.:—proverb. of a lean animal, οὐδὲν ἄλλο πλὴν γένειον καὶ κέρατα nothing but chin and horns, Ar.
= γενειάς, the beard, Hdt.
the cheek, Anth.

div1.head: γενέσιος
div1.sense: γενέσια, τά a day kept in memory of the dead, Hdt.; to be distinguished from γενέθλια a birthday-feast, though used for it in NTest.

div1.head: γένεσις
div1.sense: an origin, source, productive cause, Il.:— a beginning, in dual, τοῖν γενεσίοιν, Plat.
manner of birth, Hdt.: race, descent, Hdt.; γένεσιν by descent, Soph.
production, generation, opp. to φθορά, Plat., etc.
creation, created things, Plat.
a race, kind, family, Plat.
a generation, age, Plat.

div1.head: γενετή
div1.sense: ἐκ γενετῆς from the hour of birth, Hom.

div1.head: γενέτης
div1.sense: the begetter, father, ancestor, Eur., and in pl. parents, Eur.
the begotten, the son, Soph., Eur.
as adj., = γενέθλιοι θεοί, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: Γενετυλλίς
div1.sense: goddess of oneʼs birth-hour, Ar.

div1.head: γενηΐς
div1.sense: a pickaxe, mattock, Soph.

div1.head: γεννάδας
div1.sense: noble, Lat. generosus, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: γενναιοπρεπής
div1.sense: befitting a noble: adv. -πῶς, Ar.

div1.head: γενναῖος
div1.sense: suitable to oneʼs birth or descent, οὔ μοι γενναῖον it fits not my nobility, Il.
of persons, high-born, noble by birth, Lat. generosus, Hdt., Trag.; so of animals, well-bred, Plat., Xen.
noble in mind, high-minded, Hdt., Attic: τὸ γ. γενναιότης, Soph.:—also of actions, noble, Hdt., Trag.
of things, good of their kind, excellent, notable, Xen.: genuine, intense, δύη Soph.
adv. -ως, nobly, Hdt., etc.: comp. -οτέρως, Plat.: Sup. -ότατα, Eur.

div1.head: γενναιότης
div1.sense: nobleness of character, nobility, Eur., Thuc.: of land, fertility, Xen.

div1.head: γέννα
div1.sense: descent, birth, Aesch.
offspring, Aesch.: a generation, Aesch.
a race, family, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: γεννάω
div1.sense: 11), of the father, to beget, engender, Aesch., Soph.; rarely of the mother, to bring forth, Aesch.; οἱ γεννήσαντες the parents, Xen.; τὸ γεννώμενον the child, Hdt.:—like φύω 1. 2, as κἂν σῶμα γεννήσηι μέγα even if he grow, get a large body, i. e. if he be of giant frame, Soph.
metaph. to produce, Plat.

div1.head: γέννημα
div1.sense: that which is produced or born, a child, Soph.:—any product or work, Plat.
breeding, nature, Soph.
act. a begetting, Aesch.

div1.head: γέννησις
div1.sense: an engendering, producing, Eur., Plat.: birth, NTest.

div1.head: γεννητής
div1.sense: a parent, Soph., Plat.
γεννῆται, οἱ, (γέννα) at Athens, heads of families, Plat.

div1.head: γεννητός
div1.sense: begotten, Plat.; γεννητοὶ γυναικῶν born of women, NTest.

div1.head: γεννικός
div1.sense: noble, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: γένος
div1.sense: race, stock, family, Hom., etc.; absol. in acc., ἐξ Ἰθάκης γένος εἰμί from Ithaca I am by race, Od.; in Attic with the Art., ποδαπὸς τὸ γένος εἶ Ar.; so in dat., γένει πολίτης Dem.; οἱ ἐν γένει συγγενεῖς, Soph.; opp. to οἱ ἔξω γένους, Soph.; γένους εἶναί τινος to be of his race, Soph.
offspring, even a single descendant, a child, Lat. genus, σὸν γένος Il.; θεῖον γένος, Il.; so in Trag.
collectively, offspring, posterity, Thuc., Dem.

a race, in regard to number, γ. ἀνδρῶν mankind, Il.; ἡμιόνων, βοῶν γ. Hom., etc.:— a clan or house, Lat. gens, Hdt.; at Athens as a subdivision of the φρατρία, Plat.: — a tribe, as a subdivision of ἔθνος, Hdt.:— a caste, Hdt., Plat.: of animals, a breed, Hdt.
a race in regard to time, an age, generation, Od.; γ. χρύσειον, Hes.:—hence age, time of life, γένει ὕστερος Il.
sex, Plat.: gender, in grammar, Arist.
a class, sort, kind, Xen.
in Logic, genus, opp. to εἶδος (species), Plat.

div1.head: γέντο
div1.sense: he grasped, = ἔλαβεν, found only in this form, Il.:—said to be Aeolic for ἕλετο (ϝέλετο) like ἦνθον for ἦλθον.
syncop. for ἐγένετο, v. γίγνομαι.

div1.head: γένυς
div1.sense: the under jaw, Od.; in pl. the jaws, the mouth, Il., Trag.; so in sg., Theogn., Eur.:—generally, the side of the face, cheek, Eur.
the edge of an axe, a biting axe, Soph. (Cf. γένειον, γνάθος, Lat. gena.)

div1.head: γε
div1.sense: Enclitic Particle, serving to call attention to the word or words which it follows, by limiting the sense at least, at any rate, Lat. quidem, saltem, ὧδέ γε so at least, i. e. so and not otherwise, Il.; ὁ γʼ ἐνθάδε λεώς at any rate the people here, Soph.: with negatives, οὐ δύο γε, Lat. ne duo quidem, not even two, Il.; οὐ φθόγγος γε not the least sound, Eur.

with Pronouns:—with Pron. of 1st Pers. so closely joined, that the accent is changed, ἔγωγε, Lat. equidem; also σύγε, ὅγε, κεῖνός γε, τοῦτό γε, etc.; in Attic after relat. Pronouns, ὅς γε, οἵ γε, etc., much like Lat. quippe qui, οἵ γέ σου καθύβρισαν Soph.
after Conjunctions of all kinds, πρίν γε, before at least; εἴ γε, ἐάν γε, ἄν γε, Lat. siquidem, if that is to say, if really; etc.
exercising an influence over the whole clause:
namely, that is, Διός γε διδόντος that is if God grant it, Od.; ἀνήρ, ὅστις πινυτός γε any man, — at least any wise man, Od.
in Attic dialogue, where something is added to the statement of the previous speaker, as, ἔπεμψέ τίς σοι; Answ. καλῶς γε ποιῶν yes and quite right too, Ar.; so, πάνυ γε, etc., Plat.
implying concession, εἶμί γε well then I will go, Eur.

div1.head: γεραιός
div1.sense: old, in Hom. and Trag.; of men, with notion of dignity, like signor, Trag.; ὁ γεραιός that reverend sire, Il.:—comp. γεραίτερος, Hom.; οἱ γεραίτεροι the elders, senators, Aesch., Xen.; cf. γέρων:— Sup. γεραίτατος, Ar.; rarely = πρεσβύτατος, eldest, Theocr.
of things, ancient, Trag.

div1.head: γεραιόφλοιος
div1.sense: with old, wrinkled skin, Anth.

div1.head: γεραίρω
div1.sense: to honour or reward with a gift, τινά τινι Hom., etc.:—Pass. to be so honoured, Eur.
reversely, γ. τινί τι to present as an honorary gift, ap. Dem.
to celebrate, χοροῖσι with dances, Hdt.

div1.head: γέρανος
div1.sense: a crane, Lat. grus, Il.

div1.head: γεραρός
div1.sense: of reverend bearing, majestic, Il.
= γεραιός, Aesch.
γεραροί, οἱ, priests, Aesch.; γεραραί, priestesses, Dem.

div1.head: γεράσμιος
div1.sense: honouring, Hhymn.
= γεραρός, honoured, Eur.

div1.head: γέρας
div1.sense: a gift of honour, Hom.; τὸ γὰρ γέρας ἐστι θανόντων this is the last honour of the dead, Il.:—any privilege or prerogative conferred on kings or nobles, Hom., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: γερονταγωγέω
div1.sense: to guide an old man, Soph.

div1.head: γερόντιον
div1.sense: a little old man, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: γεροντοδιδάσκαλος
div1.sense: an old manʼs master, Plat.

div1.head: γερουσία
div1.sense: a Council of Elders, Senate, Eur.
= πρεσβεία, Eur.

div1.head: γερούσιος
div1.sense: for or befitting the seniors or chiefs, Il.; γ. ὅρκος an oath taken by them, Il.

div1.head: γέρρον
div1.sense: anything made of wicker-work:
an oblong shield, covered with ox-hide, such as the Persians used, Hdt., Xen.
γέρρα, τά, wattled huts, or booths, used in the Athen. market-place, Dem.
the wicker body of a car, Strab.

div1.head: γερροφόροι
div1.sense: a kind of troops that used wicker shields, Xen.

div1.head: γέρων
div1.sense: an old man, Hom., etc.
in political sense, γέροντες the Elders, Seniors, or Chiefs, who formed the Kingʼs Council, Hom.:—then, like Lat. Patres, the Senators, esp. at Sparta, Hdt.
as adj. old, mostly with a masc. Noun, Theogn., Aesch., etc.; but γέρον σάκος occurs in Od.

div1.head: γεῦμα
div1.sense: a taste, smack of a thing, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: γευστέος
div1.sense: one must make to taste, τινά τινος Plat.

div1.head: γεύω
div1.etym: The Root was prob. !γευς, cf. Lat. gustare.
div1.sense: to give a taste of, τι Hdt.; rarely τινά τι Eur.; or τινά τινος Plat.: cf. γευστέος.
Mid. γεύομαι, with perf. pass., to taste of a thing, c. gen., Od., Thuc.

metaph. to taste, feel, δουρὸς ἀκωκῆς, ὀϊστοῦ γεύσασθαι Hom.; γευσόμεθʼ ἀλλήλων ἐγχείαις let us try one another with the spear, Il.: to taste the sweets of, ἀρχῆς, ἐλευθερίης Hdt.; to have experience of, μόχθων, πένθους Soph., Eur.

div1.head: γέφυρα
div1.sense: a dyke, dam or mound to bar a stream, in pl., Il.; the phrase πολέμοιο γεφύραι seems to mean the ground between two lines of battle, = μεταίχμιον, Il.
a bridge, to cross a stream, Hdt., Attic; Hom. also seems to recognise this sense in the Verb γεφυρόω.

div1.head: γεφυρίζω
div1.sense: to abuse from the bridge: there was a bridge between Athens and Eleusis, and as the people passed it in procession, they had a custom of abusing whom they would: hence to abuse freely, Plut.

div1.head: γεφυριστής
div1.sense: a reviler, Plut.

div1.head: γεφυροποιός
div1.sense: bridge-maker, Lat. Pontifex, Plut.

div1.head: γεφυρόω
div1.sense: to bridge over, make passable by a bridge, γεφύρωσε δέ μιν (sc. τὸν ποταμὸν ἡ πτελέη) the fallen tree made a bridge over the river, Il.; γ. τὸν ποταμόν to throw a bridge over it, Hdt.; ἐγεφυρώθη ὁ πόρος Hdt.
to make [a passage] like a bridge, γεφύρωσε κέλευθον he made a bridge- way, Il.

div1.head: γεωγραφία
div1.sense: geography, Plut.

div1.head: γεωγράφος
div1.sense: a geographer.

div1.head: γεώδης
div1.sense: earth-like, earthy, Plat.; with deep soil, Xen.

div1.head: γεωλοφία
div1.sense: a hill of earth, Strab., Anth.

div1.head: γεώλοφος
div1.sense: crested with earth: as Subst., a hill, hillock, Xen.: so γεώλοφον, ου, τό, Theocr.

div1.head: γεωμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure the earth, to practise or profess geometry, Plat.
to measure, c. acc., Xen.

div1.head: γεωμέτρης
div1.sense: a land-measurer, geometer, Plat.

div1.head: γεωμετρία
div1.sense: geometry, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: γεωμετρικός
div1.sense: of or for geometry, geometrical, Plat.: γεωμετρικὴ (sc. τέχνη), geometry, Plat.
skilled in geometry, a geometrician, Plat.

div1.head: γεωμορία
div1.sense: a portion of land.
= γεωργία, Anth.

div1.head: γεωπείνης
div1.sense: poor in land, Hdt.

div1.head: γεωπονέω
div1.sense: to till the ground; γᾱπονεῖν Eur.

div1.head: γεωπόνος
div1.sense: a husbandman, Anth.; in Babr.

div1.head: γεωργέω
div1.sense: to be a husbandman, farmer, Plat., Xen., etc.
c. acc. to till, plough, cultivate, Thuc., Dem.
metaph. to work at a thing, practise it, Lat. agitare, Dem.; γ. ἔκ τινος to draw profit from it, live by it, Dem.

div1.head: γεωργία
div1.sense: tillage, agriculture, farming, Thuc., Plat.
in pl. farms, tilled land, Plat.

div1.head: γεωργικός
div1.sense: of or for tillage, agricultural, Ar.; ὁ γ. λέως the country folk, Ar.:— ἡ γ. (sc. τέχνη), agriculture, farming, Plat.
skilled in farming; and as Subst. a good farmer, Plat.

div1.head: γεωργός
div1.sense: tilling the ground, Ar.:—as Subst., γεωργός, ὁ, a husbandman, Hdt., Ar., Plat.

div1.head: γεωρυχέω
div1.sense: to dig in the earth, dig a mine, Hdt.

div1.head: γεωρύχος
div1.sense: throwing up the earth, Strab.

div1.head: γεωτόμος
div1.sense: cutting the ground, ploughing, Anth.

div1.head: γηγενής
div1.sense: like αὐτόχθων, earthborn, of the primeval men, Hdt., Plat.
born of Gaia or Tellus, of the Titans and Giants, Aesch., Soph.; —so of things, portentous, furious, Ar.

div1.head: γήδιον
div1.sense: a piece of land, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: γῆθεν
div1.sense: out of or from the earth, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: γηθέω
div1.sense: to rejoice, Hom.; c. acc. rei, τίς ἂν τάδε γηθήσειεν; Il.; c. part., γηθήσει προφανείσα (dual acc.) will rejoice at our appearing, Il.; γέγηθας ζῶν thou rejoicest in living, Soph.; γεγηθέναι ἐπί τινι Soph.: part. γεγηθώς, like χαίρων, Lat. impune, Soph.

div1.head: γηθοσύνη
div1.sense: joy, delight, Il.

div1.head: γηθόσυνος
div1.sense: joyful, glad at a thing, c. dat., Il.; absol., Il.

div1.head: γήϊνος
div1.sense: of earth, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: γηΐτης
div1.sense: a husbandman, Soph.

div1.head: γήλοφος
div1.sense: a hill, Xen.

div1.head: γημόρος
div1.sense: one who has a share of land, a landowner: οἱ γ., the landowners, landlords, Lat. optimates, Hdt.

div1.head: γηοχέω
div1.sense: to possess land, Hdt.

div1.head: γῆ
div1.sense: earth opp. to heaven, or land opp. to sea, Hom., etc.; κατὰ γῆν on land, by land, Thuc.; κατὰ γῆς Xen.:— ἐπὶ γῆς on earth, Soph.; κατὰ γῆς below the earth, Trag.:—the gen. with local adverbs, ἵνα γῆς, ποῦ γῆς, ubi terrarum, where in (in what quarter of) the world, where on earth, Soph., etc.
earth, as an element, opp. to air, water, fire, Plat.
a land, country, Aesch., etc.; γῆν πρὸ γῆς from land to land, Aesch.
the earth or ground as tilled, Soph., Plat.
a lump of earth, in the phrase γῆν καὶ ὕδωρ αἰτεῖν, γῆν καὶ ὕδωρ διδόναι, in token of submission, Hdt.

div1.head: γήπεδον
div1.sense: a plot of ground, Aesch.

div1.head: γηπετής
div1.sense: falling or fallen to earth, Eur.

div1.head: γηραιός
div1.sense: longer form of γεραιός, aged, in old age, Hes., Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: γηράσκω
div1.sense: to grow old, become old, and in aor. and perf. to be so, Hom., etc.; κηρύσσων γήρασκε grew old in his office of herald, Il.; of things, χρόνος γηράσκων Aesch.; c. acc. cogn., βίον γηράναι Soph.
Causal in aor1 ἐγήρᾱσα, to bring to old age, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: γῆρας
div1.sense: old age, Lat. senectus, Hom., etc.

div1.head: γηροβοσκέω
div1.sense: to feed or tend in old age, Eur.: —Pass. to be so cherished, Ar.

div1.head: γηροβοσκός
div1.sense: feeding or tending in old age, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: γηροκομία
div1.sense: care of the aged,Plut.

div1.head: γηροκόμος
div1.sense: tending old age, Hes.

div1.head: γηροτροφέω
div1.etym: fut. mid. in pass. sense, Dem.

div1.head: γηρύγονος
div1.sense: born of sound, of echo, Theocr.

div1.head: γήρυμα
div1.sense: a voice, sound, tone, Aesch.

div1.head: Γηρυόνης
div1.sense: the three-bodied giant Geryon, i. e. the shouter, Pind.

div1.head: γῆρυς
div1.sense: voice, speech, Il., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: γηρύω
div1.sense: to sing or say, speak, cry, Trag.; c. acc. cogn. to utter, Eur.
the Mid. is used in the same way, to sing, Hhymn.: c. acc. cogn., Hes., Eur.; τοὶ σκῶπες ἀηδόσι γαρύσαιντο let the owls sing against the nightingales, Theocr.

div1.head: γήτειον
div1.sense: Attic for γήθυον, a leek, Ar.

div1.head: Γιγάντειος
div1.sense: gigantic, Luc.

div1.head: Γιγαντολέτης
div1.sense: giant-killer, Anth.

div1.head: Γιγαντοφόνος
div1.sense: giant-killing, Eur.

div1.head: γίγαρτον
div1.sense: a grape-stone, Simon.: in pl. grapes, Ar.

div1.head: Γίγας
div1.sense: mostly in pl. Γίγαντες, the Giants, a savage race destroyed by the gods, Od.; the sons of Gaia, Hes.
as adj. mighty, Ζέφυρος γίγας Aesch.

div1.head: γίγγλυμος
div1.sense: a hinge joint: a joint in a coat of mail, Xen.

div1.head: γίγνομαι
div1.etym: γί-γνομαι is syncopated from γι-γένομαι, the Root being !γεν; cf. aor. 2 γενέσθαι, γένος, etc.; so Lat. gi-gno for gi-geno.
div1.sense: Radical sense, to come into being, Lat. gigni:
of persons, to be born, νέον γεγαώς new born, Od.; γεγονέναι ἔκ τινος Hdt.; more rarely ἀπό τινος Hdt.; τινος Eur.:—with Numerals, ἔτεα τρία καὶ δέκα γεγονώς, Lat. natus annos tredecim, Hdt., etc.
of things, to be produced, Plat., Xen., etc.:—of sums, ὁ γεγονὼς ἀριθμός the result or amount, Plat.

of events, to take place, come to pass, come on, happen, and in past tenses to be, Hom., etc.:— ὃ μὴ γένοιτο, Lat. quod dii prohibeant, Dem.:—c. dat. et part., γίγνεταί τί μοι βουλομένωι, ἀσμένωι I am glad at its being so, Thuc., etc.:—of sacrifices, omens, etc., to be favourable, Thuc., Xen.:—in neut. part., τὸ γενόμενον the event, the fact, Thuc.; τὰ γενόμενα the facts, Xen.; τὰ γεγενημένα former events, the past, Xen.; τὸ γενησόμενον the future, Thuc.:—of Time, ὡς τρίτη ἡμέρη ἐγένετο arrived, Hdt.

followed by a Predicate, to come into a certain state, to become, Lat. fieri, and (in past tenses), to be so and so, Hom., etc.; πάντα γιγνόμενος turning every way, Od.; so, παντοῖος γ. Hdt.; τί γένωμαι; what am I to become? i. e. what is to become of me? Aesch.; οὐκ ἔχοντες ὅ τι γένωνται Thuc.
with Adverbs, κακῶς ἐγένετό μοι it went ill with me, Hdt.; εὖ, καλῶς, γίγνεται it goes well, etc., Xen.
followed by oblique cases of Nouns,

c. gen., γ. τῶν δικαστέων to become one of the jurymen, Hdt., etc.:— to fall to the share of, belong to, ἡ νίκη γίγνεταί τινος Xen.:— to be master of, ἑαυτοῦ γ. Soph., etc.; γ. ἐντὸς ἑωϋτοῦ Hdt.:—of things, to be at, i. e. to cost, so much, c. gen. pretii, Ar.

with Preps., γ. ἀπὸ, or ἐκ δείπνου to be done supper, Hdt.; γ. εἰς τόπον to be at . . , Hdt.:—. γ. ἐξ ὀφθαλμῶν τινι to be out of sight, Hdt.; γ. ἐν τόπωι to be in a place, Hdt.; also, γ. ἐν ποιήσει to be engaged in poetry, Hdt., etc.; γ. διʼ ἔχθρας, διʼ ἔριδος γ. τινι to be at enmity with, Ar., etc.:— γ. ἐπί τινι to fall into or be in oneʼs power, Xen.:— γ. μετά τινος to be on his side, Xen.:— γ. παρά τινα to come to one, Hdt.:— γ. πρὸς τόπωι to be at or near . . , Plat.: γ. πρός τινι to be engaged in . . , Dem.; πρός τι Plat.:— γ. πρὸ ὁδοῦ to be forward on the way, Il.

div1.head: γιγνώσκω
div1.etym: γιγνώσκω is redupl. from root γνω, cf. γνῶναι, γνωτός, etc.: so Lat. gnosco.
div1.sense: to learn to know, to perceive, mark, learn, and in past tenses, to know, c. acc., Hom., etc.:—also to discern, distinguish, ὡς εὖ γιγνώσκηις ἠμὲν θεὸν ἠδὲ καὶ ἄνδρα that thou mayst discern between gods and men, Il.: c. gen., γνώτην ἀλλήλων were aware of each other, Od.; γνῶ χωομένοιο was aware of his being angry, Il.:—c. part., ἔγνων μιν οἰωνὸν ἐόντα perceived that he was a bird of omen, Od.; ἔγνων ἡττημένος I felt that I was beaten, Ar.:—but c. inf., ἵνα γνῶι τρέφειν that he may learn how to keep, Soph.

to observe, to form a judgment on a matter, to judge or think so and so, Hdt., Attic: in dialogue, ἔγνων I understand, Soph.:—Pass. to be pronounced, of a sentence or judgment, Thuc., etc.:— also, to judge, determine, decree that . . , c. acc. et inf., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: γλαγάω
div1.sense: to be milky, juicy, Anth.

div1.head: γλαγερός
div1.sense: full of milk, Anth.

div1.head: γλαγοπήξ
div1.sense: curdling milk, Anth.

div1.head: γλάγος
div1.sense: poet. for γάλα, milk, Il.

div1.head: γλακτοφάγος
div1.sense: living on milk, Il.

div1.head: γλάμων
div1.sense: blear-eyed, Ar.

div1.head: γλαυκιάω
div1.sense: glaring fiercely, of a lion, Il.

div1.head: γλαυκόμματος
div1.sense: gray-eyed, Plat.

div1.head: γλαυκός
div1.sense: in Hom., prob. without any notion of colour, gleaming, silvery, of the sea, Il., Trag.
later, certainly, with a notion of colour, bluish green, gray, Lat. glaucus, of the olive, Soph., Eur.:—esp. of the eyes light blue or gray, Lat. caesius, Hdt., Eur..

div1.head: γλαυκῶπις
div1.sense: in Hom. as epith. of Athena, with gleaming eyes, brighteyed; v. γλαυκός.

div1.head: γλαύξ
div1.sense: the owl, so called from its glaring eyes (v. γλαυκός, and cf. σκώψ) ; γλαῦκʼ Ἀθήναζε, γλαῦκʼ εἰς Ἀθήνας carry coals to Newcastle, " Ar.: Athen. silver coins were called γλαῦκες, because they were stamped with an owl, Ar.

div1.head: γλαφυρία
div1.sense: smoothness, polish, Plut.

div1.head: γλαφυρός
div1.sense: hollow, hollowed, of ships, Hom.; of caves, Hom.; of the lyre, Od.; γλ. λιμήν a deep harbour or cove, Od.
polished, finished: of persons, subtle, critical, nice, exact, Ar.:—adv. -ρῶς, and neut. as adv., Luc.

div1.head: γλάφω
div1.sense: to scrape up the ground, of a lion, Hes.

div1.head: γλευκοπότης
div1.sense: drinker of new wine, Anth.

div1.head: γλεῦκος
div1.sense: Lat. mustum, new wine, Arist.

div1.head: γλήνη
div1.sense: the pupil of the eye, eyeball, Hom., Soph.
because figures are reflected small in the pupil, a puppet, doll; as a taunt, ἔρρε, κακὴ γλήνη away, slight girl, Il.

div1.head: γλῆνος
div1.sense: in pl. things to stare at, shows, wonders, Il.

div1.head: γλισχραντιλογεξεπίτριπτος
div1.sense: greedy-pettifogging-barefaced-knavish, Ar.

div1.head: γλίσχρος
div1.sense: glutinous, sticky, clammy, Plat.:—metaph.,
sticking close, importunate, Ar.; γλίσχρως ἐπιθυμεῖν Plat.
greedy, grasping, niggardly, Arist.:—adv., Plat., Xen.; hence, with difficulty, hardly, γλίσχρως καὶ μόλις Dem.
of things, mean, shabby, meagre, Dem., Plut.

div1.head: γλίσχρων
div1.sense: a niggard, Ar.

div1.head: γλίχομαι
div1.sense: to cling to, strive after, long for, a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Plat.; ὡς στρατηγήσεις γλίχεαι art anxious how to become general, Hdt.:—c. inf. to be eager to do, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: γλοιοπότις
div1.sense: sucking up grease, Anth.

div1.head: γλοιός
div1.sense: as noun, any glutinous substance, gluten, gum, γλ. ἀπὸ τῆς ὕλης tree- gum, Hdt.
as adj. slippery, knavish, Ar.

div1.head: γλουτός
div1.sense: the rump, Il.:—pl. the buttocks, Lat. nates, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: γλυκαίνω
div1.sense: to sweeten:— Pass. to be sweetened, to turn sweet, Mosch.

div1.head: γλυκερόχρως
div1.sense: with sweet skin, Anth.

div1.head: γλυκύδακρυς
div1.sense: causing sweet tears, Anth.

div1.head: γλυκύδωρος
div1.sense: with sweet gifts, Anth.

div1.head: γλυκυηχής
div1.sense: sweet-sounding, Anth.

div1.head: γλυκυθυμία
div1.sense: sweetness of mind: benevolence, Plut.

div1.head: γλυκύθυμος
div1.sense: sweet-minded, sweet of mood, Il.
act. charming the mind, delightful. Ar.

div1.head: γλυκύκαρπος
div1.sense: bearing sweet fruit, Theocr.

div1.head: γλυκύμηλον
div1.sense: sweet-apple, as a term of endearment, Theocr.

div1.head: γλυκυμείλιχος
div1.sense: sweetly winning, Hhymn.

div1.head: γλυκύμυθος
div1.sense: sweet-speaking, Anth.

div1.head: γλυκύπαις
div1.sense: having a fair offspring, Anth.

div1.head: γλυκυπάρθενος
div1.sense: a sweet maid, Anth.

div1.head: γλυκύς
div1.sense: sweet, Il., etc.:—metaph. sweet, delightful, Hom., etc.:— γλυκύ ἐστι c. inf., Aesch., etc.
of water, sweet, fresh, opp. to πικρός, Hdt.
after Hom., of persons, sweet, dear, Soph.; ὦ γλυκύτατε my dear fellow, Ar.:—sometimes in bad sense, simple, silly, ὡς γλυκὺς εἶ. Plat.

div1.head: γλυκύτης
div1.sense: sweetness, Hdt.

div1.head: γλυπτήρ
div1.sense: a graving tool, chisel, Anth.

div1.head: γλύπτης
div1.sense: a carver, sculptor, Anth.

div1.head: γλυπτός
div1.sense: carved, Anth.

div1.head: γλύφανος
div1.sense: a tool for carving, knife, chisel, Hhymn., Theocr.; γλ. καλάμου a pen-knife, Anth.

div1.head: γλυφίς
div1.sense: the notched end of the arrow, Hom., Hdt.; πτερωταὶ γλυφίδες the arrow itself, Eur.

div1.head: γλύφω
div1.sense: to carve, cut out with a knife, Ar.; γλ. σφρηγῖδας to engrave them, Hdt.; of sculptors, Hdt.
to note down [on tablets], τόκους Anth.

div1.head: γλώξ
div1.sense: the beard of corn, Hes.

div1.head: γλωσσαλγία
div1.sense: endless talking, wordiness, Eur.

div1.head: γλώσσαλγος
div1.sense: talking till oneʼs tongue aches.

div1.head: γλῶσσα
div1.sense: the tongue, Hom., etc.

the tongue, as the organ of speech, γλώσσης χάριν through love of talking, Hes., Aesch.; ἀπὸ γλώσσης by word of mouth, Hdt., Thuc.; οὐκ ἀπὸ γλώσσης not by word of mouth, not from mere hearsay, Aesch.; so, οὐ κατὰ γλῶσσαν Soph.; ἱέναι γλῶσσαν to let loose oneʼs tongue, speak without restraint, Soph.; pl., κερτομίοις γλώσσαις, i.e. with blasphemies, Soph.:—for βοῦς ἐπὶ γλώσσηι, v. βοῦς.
a tongue, language, Hom., Hdt., etc.
the tongue or mouthpiece of a pipe, Aeschin.

div1.head: γλωσσόκομον
div1.sense: a case for the mouthpiece of a pipe: generally, a case, casket, NTest.

div1.head: γλωττίς
div1.sense: = γλῶσσα ΙΙΙ, the mouth-piece of a pipe , Luc.

div1.head: γλωχίν
div1.sense: any projecting point, hence,
the end of the yoke-strap, Il.
the point of an arrow, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: γναθμός
div1.sense: the jaw, poet. form of γνάθος, Hom.; also in pl., Od.: metaph., γναθμοὶ φαρμάκων the gnawing of poison, Eur.; for ἀλλοτρίοις γναθμοῖσι, v. ἀλλότριος.

div1.head: γνάθος
div1.sense: the jaw, properly the lower jaw, ἡ κάτω γν. Hdt.; ἔπαγε γνάθον take your teeth to it! Ar.; oft. in pl., Plat., etc.
metaph. of fire, Aesch.
metaph. also, like Lat. fauces, of a narrow strait, Aesch., Xen.
the point or edge, as of a wedge, Aesch.

div1.head: γναμπτός
div1.sense: curved, bent, Hom.
supple, pliant, of the limbs of living men, Hom.
metaph. to be bent, οὔτε νόημα γναμπτὸν ἐνὶ στήθεσσι (of Achilles), Il.

div1.head: γνάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend; γν. τινα to bend his will, Aesch.

div1.head: γνήσιος
div1.sense: of or belonging to the race, i. e. lawfully begotten, legitimate, opp. to νόθος, Hom.; φρονεῖν γνήσια to have a noble mind, Eur.; γν. γυναῖκες lawful wives, opp. to παλλακίδες, Xen.; γν. τῆς Ἑλλάδος true sons of Greece, Dem.:—adv. -ίως, lawfully, really, truly, Eur.

div1.head: γνύξ
div1.sense: with bent knee: γνὺξ ἐριπεῖν to fall on the knee, Il.

div1.head: γνῶμα
div1.sense: a mark, token, like γνώρισμα, Hdt., Soph.
an opinion, judgment, = γνώμη, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: γνωματεύω
div1.sense: to form a judgment of, discern, Plat.

div1.head: γνώμη
div1.sense: a means of knowing, a mark, token, Theogn.
the organ by which one knows, the mind: hence,

thought, judgment, intelligence, Soph.: acc. absol., γνώμην ἱκανός intelligent, Hdt.; γν. ἀγαθός Soph.; γνώμην ἔχειν to understand, Soph.; προσέχειν γνώμην to give heed, be on oneʼs guard:— ἀπὸ γνώμης with a good conscience, Aesch.; but, οὐκ ἀπὸ γν. not without judgment, with good sense, Soph.

oneʼs mind, will, purpose, Aesch., etc.; ἐν γνώμηι γεγονέναι τινί to stand high in his favour, Hdt.; τὴν γν. ἔχειν πρός τινα or τι tohave a mind, be inclined towards . . , Thuc.; ἀφʼ ἑαυτοῦ γνώμης of his own accord, Thuc.; ἐκ μιᾶς γν. of one accord, Dem.; so, μιᾶι γνώμηι Thuc.:—in pl., φίλιαι γνῶμαι friendly sentiments, Hdt.

a judgment, opinion, πλεῖστός εἰμι τῆι γνώμηι I incline mostly to the opinion that . . , Hdt.; so, ταύτηι πλεῖστος τὴν γν. or ἡ πλείστη γν. ἐστί μοι Hdt.; γνώμην ἔχειν, like λόγον ἔχ., to be right, Ar.; κατὰ γν. τὴν ἐμήν mea sententia, Hdt.; absol., γνώμην ἐμήν Ar.; παρὰ γνώμην contrary to general opinion, Thuc.:—of orators, γνώμην ἀποφαίνειν, ἀποδείκνυσθαι to deliver an opinion, Hdt.; τίθεσθαι Soph.; δηλοῦν Thuc.
like Lat. sententia, a proposition, motion, γνώμην εἰσφέρειν Hdt.; εἰπεῖν, προθεῖναι Thuc.; γνώμην νικᾶν to carry a motion, Ar.
γνῶμαι the opinions of wise men, maxims, Lat. sententiae.
a purpose, resolve, intent, Thuc.:— τινά ἔχουσα γνώμην; with what purpose? Hdt.; ἡ ξύμπασα γν. τῶν λεχθέντων the general purport . . , Thuc.

div1.head: γνωμίδιον
div1.sense: a fancy, Ar.

div1.head: γνωμολογέω
div1.sense: to speak in maxims, Arist.

div1.head: γνωμολογία
div1.sense: a speaking in maxims, Plat.

div1.head: γνωμονικός
div1.sense: (γνώμων I) fit to give judgment, Xen.: experienced in a thing, c. gen., Plat.
(γνώμων II) of or for sun-dials, Anth.

div1.head: γνωμοσύνη
div1.sense: prudence, judgment, Solon.

div1.head: γνωμοτυπικός
div1.sense: clever at coining maxims, Ar.

div1.head: γνωμοτύπος
div1.sense: maxim-coining, sententious, Ar.

div1.head: γνώμων
div1.sense: one that knows or examines, a judge, interpreter, Aesch., Thuc., Xen.
the gnomon or index of the sundial, Hdt.
οἱ γνώμονες, the teeth that mark a horseʼs age, Xen.
a carpenterʼs rule: metaph. a rule of life, Theogn.

div1.head: γνωρίζω
div1.sense: to make known, point out, explain, Aesch.:—Pass. to become known, Plat.
c. acc. pers. to make known, τινά τινι Plut.
to gain knowledge of, discover that a thing is, c. part., Soph., Thuc.
to be acquainted with, make acquaintance with, τινά Plat., Dem.

div1.head: γνώριμος
div1.sense: well-known, familiar, of persons and things, Plat., etc.:—as Subst. an acquaintance, Od., Xen., etc.
known to all, notable, distinguished, οἱ γνώριμοι the notables or wealthy class, opp. to δῆμος, Xen.:—Sup., οἱ γνωριμώτατοι Dem.
adv. -μως, intelligibly, Eur.

div1.head: γνώρισις
div1.sense: acquaintance, τινος with another, Plat.: knowledge, Plat.

div1.head: γνώρισμα
div1.sense: that by which a thing is made known, a mark, token Xen.; γνωρίσματα tokens by which a lost child is recognised, Plut.

div1.head: γνωριστέος
div1.sense: one must know, Arist.

div1.head: γνωσιμαχέω
div1.sense: Ionic Verb, to fight with oneʼs own opinion, i. e. to change oneʼs mind, to recognise oneʼs own fighting power (as compared with the enemy): hence to give way, submit, Hdt., Eur., Ar.; γν. μὴ εἶναι ὁμοῖοι to give way and confess that they are not equal, Hdt.

div1.head: γνῶσις
div1.sense: a knowing, knowledge, Plat., NTest.
acquaintance with a person, πρός τινα ap. Aeschin.
a knowing, recognising, Thuc.
a being known, fame, credit, Luc.

div1.head: γνωστέος
div1.sense: one must know, Plat.

div1.head: γνωστήρ
div1.sense: one that knows: a surety, Lat. cognitor, Xen.

div1.head: γνώστης
div1.sense: one that knows, NTest.
a surety, Plut.

div1.head: γνωστικός
div1.sense: good at knowing: ἡ -κή (sc. δύναμις) the faculty of knowing, Plat.

div1.head: γνωστός
div1.sense: known, to be known, Aesch., Soph., Xen.

div1.head: γνωτός
div1.sense: of things, perceived, understood, known, Hom.; γνωτὰ κοὐκ ἄγνωτά μοι Soph.
of persons, well-known, Od.:—as Subst. a kinsman, brother, γνωτοί τε γνωταί τε brothers and sisters, Il.

div1.head: γοάω
div1.sense: to wail, groan, weep, Hom.:—c. acc. to bewail, mourn, lament, weep for, Il.; ὑπέρ τινος Mosch.:—so also in Mid., Aesch., Soph.:—Pass., γοᾶται Aesch.

div1.head: γογγύζω
div1.sense: to mutter, murmur, NTest.

div1.head: γογγύλος
div1.sense: round, Ar.

div1.head: γογγυσμός
div1.sense: a murmuring, NTest.

div1.head: γογγυστής
div1.sense: a murmurer, NTest.

div1.head: γοερός
div1.sense: of things, mournful, lamentable, Aesch., Eur.
of persons, lamenting, Eur.

div1.head: γόης
div1.sense: one who howls out enchantments, a sorcerer, enchanter, Hdt., Eur.; γόησι καταείδοντες charming by means of sorcerers, Hdt.
a juggler, cheat, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: γοητεία
div1.sense: juggling, cheatery, Plat.

div1.head: γοητεύω
div1.sense: to bewitch, beguile, Plat.

div1.head: γοητής
div1.sense: a wailer; or, in adv. sense, of lamentation, Aesch.

div1.head: γοητικός
div1.sense: bewitching.

div1.head: γοῖ
div1.sense: γοῖ, γοῖ, to imitate the sound of pigs grunting, Anth.

div1.head: γόμος
div1.sense: a shipʼs freight, burden, tonnage, Hdt., Dem.
a beastʼs load, Babr.

div1.head: γομόω
div1.sense: to load, Babr.

div1.head: γομφιόδουπος
div1.sense: rattling between the teeth, Anth.

div1.head: γομφίος
div1.sense: a grinder-tooth, Lat. molaris, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: γομφοπαγής
div1.sense: fastened with bolts, well-bolted, Ar.

div1.head: γόμφος
div1.sense: a bolt, for ship-building, Od.; and for other uses, Hes., Aesch.:—generally, any bond or fastening, of the cross-ribs of canoes, Hdt.

div1.head: γομφόω
div1.sense: to fasten with bolts, of ships:—in Pass., γεγόμφωται σκάφος the shipʼs hull is ready built, Aesch.

div1.head: γόμφωμα
div1.sense: that which is fastened by bolts, frame-work, Plut.

div1.head: γομφωτήρ
div1.sense: a ship-builder, Anth.

div1.head: γονεύς
div1.sense: a begetter, father: in pl. γονεῖς, έων, οἱ, the parents, Hes., Attic: also, a progenitor, ancestor, Hdt.

div1.head: γονή
div1.sense: produce, offspring, Hom., etc.; so in pl., Soph.
like γενεά, γένος, a race, stock, family, Trag.
a generation, Aesch.
that which engenders, the seed, Hes., Hdt., etc.
the womb, Eur.
of the mother, child-birth, Eur., Theocr.
of the child, birth, Soph.

div1.head: γονίας
div1.sense: γονίας χειμών, perhaps a violent storm, Aesch.

div1.head: γόνιμος
div1.sense: productive, fruitful: γ. μέλεα a parentʼs limbs, Eur.
metaph. of persons, genuine, Ar.; γ. ὕδωρ Anth.

div1.head: γόνος
div1.sense: like γονή, that which is begotten, offspring, a child, Il., Hdt.; ὁ Πηλέως γ. his son, Soph.
any product, of the silver mines at Laureion, Aesch.; of tribute, Ar.
ἐς ἔρσενα γόνον to any of the male sex, Hdt.
like γένος, oneʼs race, stock, descent, Od.

div1.head: γονυπετέω
div1.sense: to fall on the knee, to fall down before one, τινι or τινα NTest.

div1.head: γονυπετής
div1.sense: falling on the knee, ἕδραι γον. a kneeling posture, Eur.

div1.head: γόνυ
div1.etym: the Ionic forms γούνατος, -ατι in Trag., but never γουνός, γουνί
div1.sense: the knee, Lat. genu, Hom., etc.

ἅψασθαι γούνων to clasp the knees as a suppliant, Il.; so ἑλεῖν, λαβεῖν, γούνων Il.; τῶν γουνάτων λαβέσθαι Hdt.; περὶ or ἀμφὶ γούνασί τινος χεῖρας βαλεῖν Od.; ἀμφὶ γόνυ τινὸς πίπτειν Eur.; γούνων λίσσεσθαι to supplicate by [clasping] the knees, Hom.; ἄντεσθαι or λίσσεσθαι πρὸς τῶν γονάτων Eur.

of a sitting posture, γόνυ κάμψειν bend the knee so as to sit down, Il.:— ἐπὶ γούνασι on oneʼs knees, of a child, Il.; πέπλον θεῖναι Ἀθηναίης ἐπὶ γούνασιν to lay it on her lap (as an offering), Il.; metaph., θεῶν ἐν γούνασι κεῖται, i. e. rests on their will and pleasure, Hom.
the knees are in Hom. the seat of strength; hence, γούνατά τινος λύειν to weaken, lame, kill him, Il.: also, metaph., ἐς γόνυ βάλλειν to bring down upon the knee, i. e. to humble, conquer, Hdt.
proverb., ἀπωτέρω ἢ γόνυ κνήμη Charity begins at home, " Theocr.
the knee or joint of grasses, such as the cane, Lat. geniculum, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: γόος
div1.sense: weeping, wailing, groaning, howling, mourning, lamentation, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: Γόργειος
div1.sense: of the Gorgon, Hom.

div1.head: Γοργίειος
div1.sense: of Gorgias, Gorgias-like, Xen.

div1.head: Γοργολόφας
div1.sense: he of the Gorgon-crest, Ar.; fem. Γοργολόφα, ης, ἡ, Ar.

div1.head: Γοργόνωτος
div1.sense: with the Gorgon on it, of a shield, Ar.

div1.head: γοργόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be hot or spirited, of a horse, Xen.

div1.head: γοργός
div1.sense: grim, fierce, terrible, Aesch., Eur.; γοργὸς ἰδεῖν terrible to behold, Xen.; of horses, hot, spirited, Xen.

div1.head: Γοργοφόνος
div1.sense: Gorgon-killing: fem. Γοργοφόνη, as a name of Athena, Eur.

div1.head: γοργωπός
div1.sense: fierce-eyed, Aesch., Eur.; γοργῶπις of Athena, Soph.

div1.head: Γοργώ
div1.etym: The regular sg. is Γοργώ, gen. Γοργοῦς, dat. Γοργοῖ : later, cases were formed as if from a nom. Γοργών, sc. gen. Γοργόνος; dat. Γοργόνι:— in pl., Γοργόνες, acc. -ας are the only forms.
div1.sense: the Gorgon, i. e. the grim one (cf. γοργός), Hom.: Hes. speaks of three Gorgons, Euryale, Stheino, Medusa, —the last being the Gorgon; her snaky head was fixed on the aegis of Athena, and all who looked on it became stone, Eur.

div1.head: γουνάζομαι
div1.sense: to clasp anotherʼs knees (v. γόνυ I. 2), and so to implore, entreat, supplicate, Il.; c. inf. to implore one to do a thing, Il.; ὑπέρ τινος in behalf of another, Il.; πρός τινος by another, Od.

div1.head: γουνόομαι
div1.etym: Dep. only in pres. and imperf.

div1.head: γουνοπαγής
div1.sense: cramping the knees, Hes.

div1.head: γουνοπαχής
div1.sense: thick-kneed, Hes. .

div1.head: γουνός
div1.sense: a hill, γ. Ἀθηνάων the hill or citadel of Athens, Od.; ὁ γ. ὁ Σουνιακός the hill of Sunium, Hdt.; ἀνὰ γουνὸν ἀλωῆς up the slope of the threshing floor, Od.

div1.head: γοῦν

etym.foreign: γε οὖν a stronger form of

div1.sense: at least then, at any rate, any way, γνώσει ὀψὲ γοῦν τὸ σωφρονεῖν Aesch.; used in quoting an example, Thuc., Xen.; also in answers, yes certainly, τὰς γοῦν Ἀθήνας οἶδα Soph.

div1.head: γραῖα
div1.sense: an old woman, fem. of γραῦς, γέρων (v. γεραιά), Od., Soph., Eur.; γραῖαι δαίμονες, of the Eumenides, Aesch.
as adj. in the obl. cases, old, withered, Aesch., Eur.
Γραῖαι, αἱ, daughters of Phorcys and Ceto, with fair faces, but hair gray from their birth, Hes.

div1.head: γραΐδιον
div1.sense: an old hag, old woman, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: γραιόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become an old woman, Anth.

div1.head: γραῖος
div1.sense: σταφυλὴ γραίη raisins, Anth. [LSJ, DGE see γραῖα]

div1.head: γράμμα
div1.sense: that which is drawn, in pl. the lines of a drawing or picture, Eur., Theocr.: in sg. a drawing, picture, Plat.

that which is written, a written character, letter, Lat. litera, Hdt., etc.; and in pl. letters, Aesch.; hence, the alphabet, Hdt., Plat.; γρ. to have learnt to read, Plat.; ἐδίδασκες γράμματα, ἐγὼ δʼ ἐφοίτων you kept school, — I went there, Dem.
a note in music, Anth.
in pl. also, a piece of writing, and, like Lat. literae, a letter, Hdt., Eur.: an inscription, epitaph, Hdt.
papers or documents of any kind, records, accounts, Ar., Oratt.:—in sg. a bill, account, NTest.
a manʼs writings, i. e. a book, treatise, Xen.:—also, letters, learning, Plat.

div1.head: γραμματεία
div1.sense: the office of the γραμματεύς, Plut.

div1.head: γραμματείδιον
div1.sense: small tablets, Dem., Plut.

div1.head: γραμματεῖον
div1.sense: that on which one writes, tablets, Plat., etc.
an account-book, register, Dem.

div1.head: γραμματεύς
div1.sense: a secretary, clerk, Lat. scriba, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: γραμματεύω
div1.sense: to be secretary, Thuc., etc.; c. gen., γρ. τοῦ συνεδρίου Epigr.

div1.head: γραμματηφόρος
div1.sense: a letter-carrier, Plut.

div1.head: γραμματικεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be a grammarian, Anth.

div1.head: γραμματικός
div1.sense: knowing oneʼs letters, well grounded in the rudiments, a grammarian, Xen., etc.:—adv. -κῶς, Plat.:— ἡ -κή (with or without τέχνη) grammar, Plat.

div1.head: γραμματιστής
div1.sense: = γραμματεύς, Hdt., Plat.
one who teaches γράμματα, a schoolmaster, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: γραμματόκος
div1.sense: mother of letters, epith. of ink, Anth.

div1.head: γραμματοκύφων
div1.sense: nickname of a γραμματεύς, a porer over records, Dem.

div1.head: γραμματολικριφίς
div1.sense: a puzzle-headed grammarian, Anth.

div1.head: γραμματοφορέω
div1.sense: to carry or deliver letters, Strab.

div1.head: γραμματοφόρος
div1.sense: letter-carrying, Polyb.

div1.head: γραμματοφυλάκιον
div1.sense: a box for keeping records, Plut.

div1.head: γραμμή
div1.sense: the stroke of a pen, a line, Plat.
= βαλβίς, the line across the course, to mark the starting or winning post, Ar.: metaph. of life, Horaceʼs ultima linea rerum, Eur.
the middle line on a board (like our draught-board), also called ἡ ἱερά, proverb., τὸν ἀπὸ γραμμῆς or ἀφʼ ἱερᾶς κινεῖν λίθον to move oneʼs man from this line, i. e. try oneʼs last chance, Theocr.
ἡ μακρά (sc. γραμμή), the long line, i. e. the line of condemnation drawn by the dicast, Ar.

div1.head: γραοσόβης
div1.sense: scaring old women, Ar.

div1.head: γραπτέος
div1.sense: one must describe, Xen.
γραπτέος, η, ον, to be described, Luc.

div1.head: γραπτήρ
div1.sense: a writer, Anth.

div1.head: γραπτός
div1.sense: marked as with letters, ἁ γραπτὰ ὑάκινθος Theocr.

div1.head: γραπτύς
div1.sense: a scratching, tearing, Od.

div1.head: γραῦς
div1.sense: an old woman, Hom., Aesch.; γρ. παλαιή Od.; γραῦς γυνή Eur.
scum, as of boiled milk, Ar.

div1.head: γραφεύς
div1.sense: a painter, Eur.
= γραμματεύς, Xen.

div1.head: γραφή
div1.sense: representation by means of lines:
drawing or delineation, Hdt.; of painting, Hdt., Plat.
a drawing, painting, picture, ὅσον γραφῆι only in a picture, Hdt.; πρέπουσα ὡς ἐν γραφαῖς Aesch.
writing, the art of writing, Plat.
a writing, Soph.: a letter, Thuc.; so in pl., like γράμματα, Eur.: ψευδεῖς γρ. false statements, Eur.
(γράφομαι) as Attic law-term, an indictment in a public prosecution, a criminal prosecution undertaken by the state, opp. to δίκη (a private action), Plat., etc.

div1.head: γραφικός
div1.sense: capable of drawing or painting, Plat.:— ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη), the art of painting, Plat.
of things, as if painted, as in painting, Plut.
of or for writing, suited for writing, Arist.: ὑπόθεσις γρ. a subject for description, Plut.: adv. -κῶς, Plut.

div1.head: γραφίς
div1.sense: a stile for writing on waxen tablets, Plat., etc.: a needle for embroidering, Anth.
embroidery, Anth.

div1.head: γράφω
div1.sense: Orig. sense, to scratch, scrape, graze, αἰχμὴ γράψεν ὀστέον Il.; σήματα γράψας ἐν πίνακι having scratched marks as tokens on a tablet, Il.:—then, to represent by lines drawn, to delineate, draw, paint, Hdt., Aesch.; εἰκὼν γεγραμμένη Ar.: also in Mid., ζῷα γράφεσθαι ζωγραφεῖν, Hdt.
to express by written characters, to write, τι Hdt.; γο. τινά to write a personʼs name, Xen.; γ. ἐπιστολήν, etc., Xen.; γρ. τι εἰς διφθέρας Hdt.
to inscribe, like ἐπιγράφω, γρ. εἰς στήλην Eur., Dem.
to write down, γρ. τινὰ αἴτιον to set him down as the cause, Hdt.
to register, enrol, γρ. τινὰ τῶν ἱππευόντων among the cavalry, Xen.; Κρέοντος προστάτου γεγράψομαι, as a dependent of Creon, Soph.

to write down a law to be proposed; hence to propose, move, γνώμην, νόμον Xen.: so, absol., γράφειν (sub. νόμον), Dem.; γρ. πόλεμον, εἰρήνην, etc., Dem.; c. inf. to move that . .; ἔγραψα ἀποπλεῖν τοὺς πρέσβεις Dem.
Mid. to write for oneself or for oneʼs own use, note down, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

as Attic law-term, γράφεσθαί τινα to indict one, τινός for some public offence, Plat., etc.; c. acc. et inf., γρ. τινὰ ἀδικεῖν Plat.: absol., οἱ γραψάμενοι the prosecutors, Plat.:—also, γράφεσθαί τι denounce as criminal, Dem.:—Pass. to be indicted, Dem., etc.; τὰ γεγραμμένα the articles of the indictment, Dem.; τὸ γεγραμμένον the penalty named in the indictment, Plat.:—but γέγραμμαι usually takes the sense of the Mid., to indict, Dem.

div1.head: γραώδης
div1.sense: like an old woman, Strab., NTest.

div1.head: γρηγορέω
div1.etym: late pres., formed from perf. ἐγρήγορα
div1.sense: to be awake or wakeful, NTest.

div1.head: γριπηίς
div1.sense: γρῑπηῒς, τέχνη, ἡ, the art of fishing, Anth.

div1.head: γρίπων
div1.sense: a fisherman, Anth.

div1.head: γρῖφος
div1.sense: like γρῖπος, a fishing-basket, creel, made of rushes, Plut.
metaph. anything intricate, a dark saying, riddle, Ar.

div1.head: γρύζω
div1.sense: to say γρῦ, to grunt, grumble, mutter, Ar.

div1.head: γρυλίζω
div1.sense: to grunt, of swine, Ar.

div1.head: γρῦλος
div1.sense: a pig, porker, Plut.

div1.head: γρυπάετος
div1.sense: a kind of griffin or dragon, Ar.

div1.head: γρυπός
div1.sense: hook-nosed, with aquiline nose, opp. to σιμός, Xen., Plat.
generally, curved, γρυπὴ γαστήρ a round paunch, Xen.

div1.head: γρυπότης
div1.sense: hookedness, of the nose, opp. to σιμότης, Xen.

div1.head: γρῦ
div1.sense: a grunt, as of swine: hence οὐδὲ γρῦ ἀποκρίνεσθαι to answer not even with a grunt, Ar.; οὐδὲ γρῦ ἀπαγγέλλειν Dem.

div1.head: γρύψ
div1.sense: a griffin or dragon, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: γρώνη
div1.sense: a cavern, a hollow vessel, kneading-trough, Anth.

div1.head: γύαλον
div1.sense: a hollow, as of the cuirass (θώρηξ), which was composed of a back-piece and breast-piece, called γύαλα, joined at the sides by clasps or buckles (πόρπαι, περόναι), Il.
the hollow of a vessel or a hollow vessel, Eur.
the hollow of a rock, Soph.: a cavern, grotto, Eur.
in pl., vales, dales, dells, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: γύης
div1.sense: the piece of wood in a plough, to which the share was fitted, the plough-tree, Lat. buris, Hes.

div1.head: γύης2
div1.sense: a piece of land (cf. Lat. juger), Eur.: mostly in pl. lands, fields, Aesch., Soph.:— metaph. of a wife, Soph.

div1.head: γυιοβαρής
div1.sense: weighing down the limbs, Aesch.

div1.head: γυιοβόρος
div1.sense: gnawing the limbs, Hes.

div1.head: γυῖον
div1.sense: a limb, Hom., in pl., γυῖα λέλυντο, τρόμος or κάματος λάβε γυῖα, so Trag.; γυῖα ποδῶν the feet, Il.; γυῖα the hands, Theocr.; and γυῖον in sg. the hand, Theocr.

div1.head: γυιοπαγής
div1.sense: stiffening the limbs, Anth.

div1.head: γυιοπέδη
div1.sense: a fetter, Aesch.

div1.head: γυιός
div1.sense: lame, Anth.

div1.head: γυιοτακής
div1.sense: wasting the limbs, Anth.
pass. with pining limbs, Anth.

div1.head: γυιόχαλκος
div1.sense: of brasen limb, Anth.

div1.head: γυιόω
div1.sense: to lame, Il.; γυιωθείς lame, Hes.

div1.head: γυλιαύχην
div1.sense: long-necked, scraggy-necked, Ar.

div1.head: γυλιός
div1.sense: a long-shaped wallet, Ar.

div1.head: γυμνάζω
div1.sense: to train naked, train in gymnastic exercise: generally, to train, exercise, Xen.: c. inf. to train or accustom persons to do a thing, Xen.; so also, γ. τινά τινι to accustom him to it, Xen.:—Mid. to exercise for oneself, practise, γ. τέχνην Plat.:—Pass. to practise gymnastic exercises, Hdt., etc.: generally, to practise, exercise oneself, Thuc., Xen.; γυμνάζεσθαι πρός τι to be trained for a thing, Plat.; περί τι in a thing, Xen.
metaph. to wear out, harass, distress, Aesch.:—Pass., Aesch.

div1.head: γυμνασία
div1.sense: exercise, NTest.

div1.head: γυμνασιαρχέω
div1.sense: to be gymnasiarch, at Athens, Oratt.: Mid., Xen.:—Pass. to be supplied with gymnasiarchs, Xen.

div1.head: γυμνασιάρχης
div1.sense: a gymnasiarch, who superintended the palaestrae, and paid the training masters, Dem., etc.

div1.head: γυμνασιαρχία
div1.sense: the office of a gymnasiarch, Xen.

div1.head: γυμνασιαρχικός
div1.sense: of or for a gymnasiarch, Plut.

div1.head: γυμνάσιον
div1.sense: in pl. bodily exercises, Hdt., etc.
in sg. the public place where athletic exercises were practised, the gymnastic school, Eur., etc.; ἐκ θἠμετέρου γυμνασίου from our school, Ar.: pl., γ. ἱππόκροτα the hippodrome, Eur.

div1.head: γυμνάς
div1.sense: fem. of γυμνός, naked, Eur.
trained, Eur.

div1.head: γυμναστέος
div1.sense: one must practise, Xen.

div1.head: γυμναστής
div1.sense: a trainer of professional athletes, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: γυμναστικός
div1.sense: fond of athletic exercises, skilled in them, Plat.: ἡ -κή (with or without τέχνη), gymnastics, Plat.:—adv. -κῶς, Ar.

div1.head: γυμνής
div1.sense: a light-armed foot-soldier, slinger, Hdt., Eur., Xen.

div1.head: γυμνητεύω
div1.sense: to be light-armed, Plut.

div1.head: γυμνήτης
div1.sense: as adj. naked, Luc.

div1.head: γυμνητεία
div1.sense: the light-armed troops, Thuc.

div1.head: γυμνητικός
div1.sense: of or for a light-armed soldier (γυμνής), Xen.

div1.head: γυμνικός
div1.sense: of or for gymnastic exercises, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: γυμνιτεύω
div1.sense: to be naked, NTest.

div1.head: γυμνοπαιδίαι
div1.sense: a festival in honour of those who fell at Thyrea, at which boys went through gymnastic exercises, Hdt., Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: γυμνοσοφισταί
div1.sense: the naked philosophers of India, Plut.

div1.head: γυμνός
div1.sense: naked, unclad, Od., etc.
unarmed, Il., etc.:— τὰ γυμνά the parts not covered by armour, the exposed parts, Thuc., Xen.: esp. the right side (the left being covered by the shields), Thuc.
of things, γυμνὸν τόξον an uncovered bow, i. e. taken out of the case, Od.
c. gen. stripped of a thing, Hdt., Aesch.
in common language γυμνός meant lightly clad, i. e. in the tunic only (χιτών), without the mantle (ἱμάτιον), Lat. nudus, Hes., Xen.
bare, mere, NTest.

div1.head: γυμνότης
div1.sense: nakedness, NTest.

div1.head: γυμνόω
div1.sense: to strip naked, Soph.; τὰ ὀστέα τῶν κρεῶν γ. to strip the bones of their flesh, Hdt.:—in Pass., of warriors, to be left naked or exposed, Hom.; so, τεῖχος ἐγυμνώθη the wall was left bare, i. e. defenceless, Il.: but also to strip oneself naked or to be stript naked, Od.; c. gen., ἐγυμνώθη ῥακέων he stript himself of his rags, Od.; so later, γυμνωθὲν ξίφος Hdt.

div1.head: γύμνωσις
div1.sense: a stripping.
nakedness: ἐξαλλάσσειν τὴν ἑαυτοῦ γ. his defenceless side (cf. γυμνός 2), Thuc.

div1.head: γυμνωτέος
div1.sense: to be stript of, τινός Plat.

div1.head: γυναικεῖος
div1.sense: of or belonging to women, like women, befitting them, feminine, Lat. muliebris, Od., etc.:— ἡ γ. θεός, the Roman bona dea, Plut.: γ. πόλεμος war with women, Anth.
in bad sense, womanish, effeminate, Plat., etc.
as Subst. ἡ γυναικηΐη = γυναικών, the womenʼs apartments, harem, Hdt.

div1.head: γυναικίας
div1.sense: a weakling, Luc.

div1.head: γυναικόβουλος
div1.sense: devised by a woman, Aesch.

div1.head: γυναικογήρυτος
div1.sense: proclaimed by a woman, Aesch.

div1.head: γυναικοκρασία
div1.sense: a womanʼs nature, Plut.

div1.head: γυναικοκρατία
div1.sense: the dominion of women, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: γυναικόμιμος
div1.sense: aping women, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: γυναικόμορφος
div1.sense: in womanʼs shape, Eur.

div1.head: γυναικονομία
div1.sense: the office of γυναικονόμος, Arist.

div1.head: γυναικονόμος
div1.sense: one of a board of magistrates, appointed to maintain good manners among the women, Arist.

div1.head: γυναικοπληθής
div1.sense: full of women, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: γυναικόποινος
div1.sense: woman-avenging, Aesch.

div1.head: γυναικοφίλης
div1.sense: woman-loving, Theocr.

div1.head: γυναικωνῖτις
div1.sense: the womenʼs apartments in a house, opp. to ἀνδρών (cf. γυναικών), Lys.:— the women of the harem, Plut.

div1.head: γυναιμανής
div1.sense: mad for women, Il.

div1.head: γύναιος
div1.sense: γύναια δῶρα presents made to a woman, Od.
as Subst., little woman, wifey, as a term of endearment, Ar.:— in a contemptuous sense, a weak woman, Dem., etc.

div1.head: γυνή
div1.etym: Prob. from same Root as γίγνομαι.
div1.sense: a woman, Lat. femina, opp. to man, Hom., etc.; with a second Subst., γυνὴ ταμίη housekeeper, δέσποινα γ., δμωαὶ γυναῖκες, etc., Hom.:—in voc. often as a term of respect, mistress, lady, Theocr.:— πρὸς γυναικός like a woman, Aesch.
a wife, spouse, opp. to παρθένος, Hom., Xen.
a mortal woman, opp to a goddess, Hom.

div1.head: γύννις
div1.sense: a womanish man, Theocr.

div1.head: γυπάριον
div1.sense: a nest, cranny, Ar.

div1.head: γύπη
div1.sense: a vultureʼs nest: a hole.

div1.head: γύπινος
div1.sense: of a vulture, Luc.

div1.head: γυρεύω
div1.sense: to run round in a circle, Strab., Babr.

div1.head: γυρητόμος
div1.sense: tracing a circle, Anth.

div1.head: γυρῖνος
div1.sense: a tadpole, Plat.

div1.head: γυροδρόμος
div1.sense: running round in a circle, Anth.

div1.head: γῦρος
div1.sense: a ring, circle, Polyb.

div1.head: γυρός
div1.sense: round, γυρὸς ἐν ὤμοισι round- shouldered, Od.

div1.head: γύψος
div1.sense: chalk, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: γυψόω
div1.sense: to rub with chalk, chalk over, Hdt.

div1.head: γύψ
div1.sense: a vulture, Il.; cf. αἰγυπιός.

div1.head: γωνία
div1.sense: a corner, angle, Hdt.
a joinerʼs square, Plat.

div1.head: γωνιασμός
div1.sense: a squaring the angles: ἐπῶν γωνιασμοί the finishing of verses by square and rule, Ar.

div1.head: γωνιώδης
div1.sense: angular, Thuc.

div1.head: γωρυτός
div1.sense: a bow-case, quiver, Od.; as fem., Anth.
